ASPEN 1.1.2

    Reference

    All functions

    allelicSwitch()

    Performs a number of test to evaluate changes in allelic distribution between the groups.

    beta_binom_test()

    Performs likelihood ratio test between H_0: no allelic imbalance (mean allelic ratio = 0.5, or another theoretical value based on the global parameter estimates) and H_1: allelic imbalance is present. Likelihoods for H_0 and H_1 are calculated based on the mu and theta parameters from correct_theta function

    correct_theta()

    Fits a local regression model with dispersion as a function of total gene counts. Predicted values are the expected dispersion for genes with similar expression levels The initial dispersion estimates are shrunk towards the common dispersion

    correct_theta_bygroup()

    Fits a local regression model with dispersion as a function of total gene counts. Predicted values are the expected dispersion for genes with similar expression levels The initial dispersion estimates are shrunk towards the common dispersion

    estim_bbparams()

    Estimate beta-binomial distribution parameters. This is the initial function that estimates beta-binomial distribution parameters for the allele-specific counts for each gene. The users may filter out low abundant or low expressed genes through quality control parameters of minimum number of reads per cell and minimum number of cells per gene.

    estim_bbparams_bygroup()

    Estimate beta-binomial distribution parameters. This is the initial function that estimates beta-binomial distribution parameters for the allele-specific counts for each gene. The users may filter out low abundant or low expressed genes through quality control parameters of minimum number of reads per cell and minimum number of cells per gene.

    estim_delta()

    Estimating appropriate tuning paramater delta and the number of degrees of freedom, N. We assume that dispersion follows Gamma distribution. Appropriate shrinkage is selected based on the MLE of the the difference between fitted dispersion and shrunk dispersion

    geBoxplot()

    Boxplot of allele-specific expression

    glob_disp()

    Estimates global beta-binomial distribution parameters on all genes together to evaluate the degree of skewness towards the reference allele. For the estimation, genes located on the sex chromosomes and imprinted genes are excluded

    makedf()

    preparing data frame for plotting

    make_plotdf_simul()

    posterior counts simulated under the expected dispersion

    plot_disp()

    Plot to visualize original and shrunk dispersion

    plot_disp_fit_mean()

    Plot to visualize allelic ratio modelled as a function of total gene counts

    plot_disp_fit_theta()

    Plot to visualize dispersion modelled as a function of total gene counts

    plot_distr()

    plotting allelic ratio distribution

    plot_exp_disp()

    plotting mean gene expression vs allelic dispersion

    plot_glob_params()

    Plot histogram of allelic ratio distribution across all genes with beta function based on alpha and beta global parameters

    plot_MA()

    Plotting distribution of allelic ratio over mean expression

    plot_theta_density()

    Density plot comparing allelic ratio distribution under observed and expected dispersion
